TopicTitle: Female Kerbals Make the Best Astronauts

Articles.Content:
...because the entirety of the ground crew is still male. What else do the femme kerbals have to do but go to space?

Is anybody else running an all-female space program? I kept Jebediah for old times' sake, and he'll probably tag along on some interplanetary missions to bodies he hasn't seen in my older saves. Bill and Bob are now Kax and Zela, my transgender crew. I haven't rescued a single male kerbal, and so far, I've rescued all the female kerbals which have popped up.

I'm appreciative that Squad have included female kerbals, but they certainly didn't take it very far. I'm irritated that there's no orange-suit female scientist or engineer.

Psh, no they don't!

I know from personal experience with Daphjorie Kerman, who broke the solar panels on my Mun lander. No other Kerbal has ever done that in the history of my space program, seriously!

I just hire the kerbals as they come up. Can't be bothered with sorting by gender.

I'm glad they were added as its something I wanted for a long time. Refusing to use male kerbals strikes me as just as strange as refusing to use female ones though.
My hiring policy is to hire the Kerbal with the funniest name.

> 
> I just hire the kerbals as they come up. Can't be bothered with sorting by gender.
> I'm glad they were added as its something I wanted for a long time. Refusing to use male kerbals strikes me as just as strange as refusing to use female ones though.

We were forced to use only male Kerbals for the longest time - I think it's a cool idea to have a female-only save file. Each to their own, though.

Coincidentally, in my current career save, my highest-level Kerbals are female. Magie Kerman and Zeli Kerman. Zeli was the first Kerbal who set foot on another planet - Duna; Magie was the first to flyby Moho (along with Valentina and Bill), and was the first Kerbal to set foot on another planet's moon - Gilly.

> 
> My hiring policy is to hire the Kerbal with the funniest name.

Same here. That said, if I have a choice, I'll take a female. Don't ask me why. But Jeb and Val are my original pilots, going forth into the ughknown together.

> 
> My hiring policy is to hire the Kerbal with the funniest name.

Exactly! That's pretty much the only thing I consider when hiring them! (although in my current career I've hardly hired any, my recruitment process is to except all rescue contracts)

> 
> Psh, no they don't!
> I know from personal experience with Daphjorie Kerman, who broke the solar panels on my Mun lander. No other Kerbal has ever done that in the history of my space program, seriously!

\*Bob breaks a solar panel\*

"Bob is a terrible astronaut!"

\*Val breaks a solar panel\*

"Women are terrible astronauts!"

Stolen from [XKCD](https://xkcd.com/385/)

(PS I know you're joking. I'm just expanding on it)
I accidentally stranded Jeb, Bill and Bob in orbit in my test save (game crashed, no revert possible, ship design was not meant to be practical). So now Val is my primary test pilot.

> 
> \*Bob breaks a solar panel\*
> "Bob is a terrible astronaut!"
> 
> \*Val breaks a solar panel\*
> 
> "Women are terrible astronauts!"
> 
> [...]

> 
> ... and that's the real problem with **all** females: they **always** generalise! 
> ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

My Career mode save has had only girl astronauts show up beyond the original 4 but thats because my current hiring standards are that I only poach astronauts whose former employers left them in need of rescue contracts.

All the male astronauts are for hire while every single rescue contract is for female astronauts (then again, every single VIP and tourist has been so far).
I've had the same experience: all my rescued Kerbils are female. And I recruit exclusively by doing rescue contracts. So, except for my original 3, my entire program is female. I like it!
I've been taking along at least one female Kerbal every mission because they're new and hilarious, and the screenshots are different. My space program is roughly 50/50 gendered, though.

I usually just give the ship the first pilot on the list. Tourists, now those you've got to be careful with!

Then again, my ships have only got room for one in Career right now...

> 
> I accidentally stranded Jeb, Bill and Bob in orbit in my test save (game crashed, no revert possible, ship design was not meant to be practical). So now Val is my primary test pilot.

With the way I play KSP, that would be the perfect scenario for a RESCUE MISSION!

> 
> With the way I play KSP, that would be the perfect scenario for a RESCUE MISSION!

I could do that, I suppose, or hyperedit them back somewhere safe. I haven't bothered, it's a save just for testing.
After several crashes by attempting supersonic landing, Jeb is banned from the spaceplane hangar. Now Val flies all my planes.

I figured I've been forced to have an all-male space program for most of a year; to balance things out I'll have an all-female space program for a while. I'll probably go back to mixed after the next update.

Same here. I have 6 rescued female Kerbals. I only recruit through rescues. I've accepted and succeeded at every rescue. I'm not very far along yet, but that's how it has been.

Also, Jeb and Bob mysteriously died, so Bill is the only male left at the moment! His dream come true.

I picked Valentina to pilot my first Mun landing in my new career mode, figured "let the rookie have a go"... I underestimated the amount of fuel I needed (been awhile since I've played KSP fully)... and ran out about 10k meters up, still going 200m/s.... so I tried to have Val bail from the plummeting lander and try to slow herself down with her RCS pack.... Somehow she survived a pretty hard impact into the Munar surface, and now I guess I have to send Jeb to rescue her... Typical woman ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif) (plz don't hurt me, I joke D: )

On one hand... first female piloted Mun Landing fails. On the other hand, first pilot I ever had to survive a 10,000 meter fall into the surface of the Mun...
My policy thus far has been to hire the least stupid candidate for the position. I have a good spread of male to female, so I think it's working out alright.

> 
> We were forced to use only male Kerbals for the longest time - I think it's a cool idea to have a female-only save file. Each to their own, though.

This was my thinking, and seeing only Valentina introduced in the initial crew, along with still-all-male ground crew, pushed me to actually do it.
Why does it matter? They are going to die anyways.

Female Kerbals are all dead in my save, the more they offer for me to hire the more I send crashing into some random planet/moon. Female Kerbals have werid looking heads and eyes makes them look really bad and I dont want to deal with that eyesore.

> 
> Why does it matter? They are going to die anyways.

YMMV. I haven't lost one yet.
